value: — an international port city of rich history and brief tragedy.
is the second largest city in Nagasaki.  Sasebo has American culture because there is an American military base in Sasebo.
is a famous island between the Japanese island of Kyushu and the Korean Peninsula.
[[Iki] is another island between Tsushima and the Nagasaki prefecture.

China Eastern Airlines and Korean Air are operating from

, but these flights are not served daily. You should check the flight schedule beforehand if you are to use these international flights.

On the other hand, there are many domestic flighets to Nagasaki every day. You can fly directly from
Haneda Airport (by JAL, ANA and SNA),

Naha Airport (by ANA).
Oriental Air Bridge, a local airline of Nagasaki, is operating the flight from

, Gotou and Iki- , with prop jet.

JR railway company provides express service from adjacent prefectures. From Hakata Station in
, you can use the Limited Express "KAMOME"(to Nagasaki), "MIDORI"(to Sasebo) or "Huis Ten Bosch"(to Huistenbosch Resort in Sasebo).

value: content=Sasebo City, Nagasaki (90-minute train ride on the Seaside Liner from Nagasaki Station). A very large hostel that looks a bit like an American college dorm complex with a gym, a cafeteria, and a couple of fields. Lots of rooms, all private (1-4 people per room), from ¥2625 per person per night. It's a good base for exploring the Nagasaki-Sasebo-Hus Ten Bosch area. Right next to
